articles.title: SAN JOSE AMATEUR ASTRONOMERS MONTHLY BULLETIN JUNE 1972
articles.summary: This document is the June 1972 monthly bulletin for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club. It primarily lists the executive officers, including the President, Vice-President, Secretary, and Treasurer, along with their respective names and phone numbers.

articles.title: DUES DUES DUES DUES DUES DUES
articles.summary: June marks the annual membership renewal period for San Jose Amateur Astronomers (SJAA). For a $10 fee, members receive a Sky & Telescope subscription, the monthly bulletin, and access to club resources including a library and various telescopes, with new instruments coming soon. Members wishing to renew or join should send their dues and the Sky & Telescope blue card to Emmet Murphy.

articles.title: JUNE 2, BOARD ELECTIONS AND EQUIPMENT NIGHT
articles.summary: The June 2 meeting will feature board elections for four two-year term positions, with a list of expiring members and candidates provided. Additionally, an "equipment night" will be held, encouraging members to bring and discuss their astronomical equipment. The meeting will take place at 8 P.M. in the Community Bank Building.

articles.title: JUNE 9, BOARD MEETING AT COMMUNITY BANK 8 P.M.
articles.summary: A board meeting is scheduled for June 9th at 8 PM at Community Bank, where officers for the upcoming year will be elected by board members. Following the elections, preparations for the Annual Banquet on July 16th will be discussed. All members and guests are invited to attend.

articles.title: JUNE 10, STARPARTY AT FREMONT PEAK STATE PARK
articles.summary: The article announces an upcoming overnight star party at Fremont Peak State Park on June 10. This event is hosted by the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, continuing a tradition they have maintained for the past six years at this location.

articles.title: SAN JOSE AMATEUR'S ANNUAL BANQUET & INSTALLATION OF OFFICERS
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers will hold their Annual Banquet and Installation of Officers on July 16, 1972, at The Red Carpet Restaurant. Dr. Witteborn, head of NASA's "Airborn Astronomy," will speak on "Infra-Red Astronomy From Above." The event includes a happy hour and dinner (Prime Rib or Chicken Kiev) for around ten dollars, with a reservation deadline of July 10th. A scheduled public star party on June 17th has been postponed due to banquet preparations.

articles.title: ADDITIONS AND CORRECTIONS TO SUMMER CALENDAR
articles.summary: This document provides updates and corrections to a summer calendar of events. Key changes include the postponement of a public star party scheduled for June 17th, a planning meeting on July 7th, a star party near Lick Observatory on July 8th, and the annual banquet with officer installations on July 16th.
